{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2989549,"name":"","username":"Max2370","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max2370/{size}/171266_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-12T00:27:42.354Z","cooked":"

Last offseason, I set up a TI Launchpad for a custom input device using NI’s Gamepad tool. Looking through the game tools this year, I can’t find the gamepad tool to set the launchpad up. Is the gamepad tool hidden somewhere in setup, or did they remove it? And if it was removed, are the launchpads still usable as input devices?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-01-12T00:27:42.354Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":110,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":583.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399792,"topic_slug":"no-gamepad-tool-in-2022-ni-game-tools","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/button-box-button-board-recommendations/422059/15","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Button Box/Button Board Recommendations?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39742,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Calm, Cool, Calm, Loose, and Calm - 5 Cs of Drive Team"},"post_url":"/t/no-gamepad-tool-in-2022-ni-game-tools/399792/1","custom_user_title":"Calm, Cool, Calm, Loose, and Calm - 5 Cs of Drive Team","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2989952,"name":"Michael Cameron","username":"holazola","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/holazola/{size}/260128_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-12T15:36:10.100Z","cooked":"

Yes, it is still usable as an input device. You can still locate older versions of firmware and the gamepad tool. But I was also wondering about this too. Is the TI MSP430 Launchpad really not being officially supported anymore? There has to be a lot of these boards out there still being used by FRC teams.

But also curious what others are using that have >/= 16 button inputs and >/= 6 analog inputs on a single board

Not sure if it was planned to be included in the kickoff release or not. Either way I rebuilt it for the 2022 tools, you can find it here (along with the source) https://github.com/TI-FIRST/FRC-Gamepad-Tool/releases/tag/V1.0.2022

I don’t actually have an MSP430F5529 launchpad handy at the moment, please give this a try and let me know if it works.

Hi Will,

I just tried running it on my Windows 10 system and it shows no devices to load firmware on. The drivers did install fine, and in device manager I do see both com ports for the Launchpad device.

Also there is a different firmware available that another team modified and I have used it in the past .

This modification to the stock MSP430-Gamepad firmware automatically scales the analog axes to the 12-bit ADC resolution, allowing use of the analog axes without calibration.

github.com

Release scale-analog-values-1.0 · CougarProgramming623/MSP430-Gamepad

//github.com/CougarProgramming623/MSP430-Gamepad/releases/tag/20181118

This modification to the stock MSP430-Gamepad firmware automatically scales the analog axes to the 12-bit ADC resolution, allowing use of the analog axes without calibration. This modified firmware...

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T16:47:37.770Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399792,"topic_slug":"no-gamepad-tool-in-2022-ni-game-tools","display_username":"Phalanx","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/CougarProgramming623/MSP430-Gamepad/releases/tag/20181118","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":5123,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming/EE Mentor 6901 (formerly 1089, 5431, 5411, 6369, FSM), LRI"},"post_url":"/t/no-gamepad-tool-in-2022-ni-game-tools/399792/6","custom_user_title":"Programming/EE Mentor 6901 (formerly 1089, 5431, 5411, 6369, FSM), LRI","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2994105,"name":"Phalanx","username":"Phalanx","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/phalanx/{size}/1645_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-18T21:04:26.636Z","cooked":"

I can share some new information which hopefully can help others that would like to use the Launchpad device.

For my setup I needed drivers installed for the device. They did show in device manager as COMx ports in device manager, but they didn’t show as
MSP Application UART(COMx) and
MSP Debug Interface(COMy)

Since I wasn’t sure if the existing drivers in the tools/driver subdirectory would work with Windows 10 I visited TI’s web site MSPDS Driver or library | TI.com.

I needed to create a TI account(free/easy) and I was then able to download the latest driver package.
MSPDS-USB-DRIVERS — Stand-alone Driver Installer for USB Low-Level Drivers.

I installed that package on my Windows 10 system and presto the Launchpad appeared in device manager as
MSP Application UART(COMx) and
MSP Debug Interface(COMy)

I was then able to successfully run the Gamepad Tool and load the firmware.

I successfully used both the Gamepad tool version published here as well as an older version from 2019 that I copied from old Windows 7 system.

They both worked successfully on my new Windows 10 system with this seasons software.

I thought I’d share, and hopefully this helps others than are experiencing this issue.
